summary: This bill, the 761st Tank Battalion Congressional Gold Medal Act, proposes awarding a Congressional Gold Medal to the 761st Tank Battalion, also known as the Black Panthers, in recognition of their pivotal role in the Allied forces' success in Europe during World War II. It acknowledges their bravery, their status as the first Black armored unit to fight in the war, and their subsequent lack of recognition upon returning home. The bill outlines the presentation details, design of the medal, its placement in the National Museum of African American History and Culture, and the possibility of striking and selling duplicate bronze medals.
